donationtypes.description: Annadanam is Mahadanam or the greatest donation in Hindu religion and is an essential part of Sanatana Dharma tradition. The food donation is not limited to feeding a human being but it encompasses all living beings.

Annadanam is Mahadanam or the greatest donation in Hindu religion and is an essential part of Sanatana Dharma tradition. The food donation is not limited to feeding a human being but it encompasses all living beings.

Vastra Dhanam, or the act of donating clothes, holds significant importance in many traditions and cultures. In Hinduism, it is considered a virtuous act that brings blessings and good karma. The donation of clothes to those in need is seen as a way to show compassion and support for the less fortunate.

Prasam food and water offered to a deity during worship (puja). It is believed that the deity partakes of and then returns the offering, thereby consecrating it. The offering is then distributed and eaten by the worshippers.
